title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 26 April 2016 - XWiki
content:

09:04 <martinus\_\_> "If you are going to use the LDAP Admin Extension, which makes it easier to configure LDAP, then you only need to uncomment xwiki.authentication.authclass property and nothing else."

12:28 <gdelhumeau> Please do not commit anymore on master  
12:51 <xwiki\_finstern> hello  
12:52 <xwiki\_finstern> sorry to bug you here, I would need some help on the livetable macro extraparams options.  
12:53 <xwiki\_finstern> I'm trying to show multiple class in my table, using the set ($options = { ...  
12:55 <xwiki\_finstern> extraParams seem to be the solution, as I have a common property in each of my class in the space  
12:55 <xwiki\_finstern> and would like to show every documents based on a class having this property  
12:56 <xwiki\_finstern> I believe I'm close but can't find the right way to use it  
12:56 <xwiki\_finstern> (yes the property is set as one of the columns)  
12:57 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
13:06 <Aranjedeath> has quit  
13:58 <Aranjedeath> has joined #xwiki  
14:08 <Enygma`1> has joined #xwiki  
14:08 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
14:11 <Enygma`> has quit  
14:28 <boubou> martinus\_\_ ok thx  
14:28 <boubou> [16:51:09] <boubou> What is wrong with that # xwiki.authentication.ldap.user\_group=cn=xwiki\_users,ou=Applications,ou=domain,c=domain,c=qc,c=ca  
14:28 <boubou> [16:51:51] <boubou> my group object is domain.qc.ca/DOMAIN/Applications/xwiki\_users  
14:29 <boubou> what about that ?  
14:34 <ClemensR> @xwiki\_finstern  you probably need to write your own result page (i.e. set resultPage and handle the XWQL / HQL query there that fetchres all pages  
14:34 <ClemensR> ah, no, it should work with the "extraParams" : "&yourProperty\_class=yourSpace.yourClass"   ... just forget what I wrote  
14:35 <martinus\_\_> boubou, did you uncomment this line (ie remove the #) ?  
14:35 <boubou> yes  
14:36 <boubou> ineeed  
14:36 <boubou> xwiki.authentication.ldap.user\_group=cn=xwiki\_users,ou=Applications,ou=cpu,c=cpu,c=qc,c=ca  
14:37 <xwiki\_finstern> thank you ClemensR  
14:37 <xwiki\_finstern> is there somewhere an example of how to use it ?  
14:37 <boubou> martinus\_\_ I cant see why it fails if I enable debug :S  
14:37 <xwiki\_finstern> currently I try like that :  
14:37 <martinus\_\_> boubou, could you share the full ldap section of your xwiki.cfg ?  
14:37 <xwiki\_finstern> #set ($options = {  
14:38 <boubou> sure  
14:38 <xwiki\_finstern>    "&Typecheck=Checklist.Recette\_ArchetypeClass&Typecheck=Checklist.Integration\_ArchetypeClass",  
14:38 <xwiki\_finstern> argh  
14:38 <xwiki\_finstern>    "extraParams" : "&Typecheck=Checklist.Recette\_ArchetypeClass&Typecheck=Checklist.Integration\_ArchetypeClass",  
14:39 <xwiki\_finstern> (Checklist is my property)  
14:39 <xwiki\_finstern> no .. grr  
14:39 <xwiki\_finstern> Typecheck is my property  
14:39 <xwiki\_finstern> Checklist is the space  
14:39 <xwiki\_finstern> Recette\_ArchetypeClass is one of the class  
14:43 <boubou> martinus\_\_ http://pastebin.com/hATjYML1  
14:43 <boubou> If I comment the line #37, it works perfectly but if I uncomment it, it stop working  
14:44 <boubou> my user is in the group xwiki\_users  
14:47 <martinus\_\_> boubou, are you sure 'cn=xwiki\_users,ou=Applications,ou=cpu,c=cpu,c=qc,c=ca' is the full dn of your group ?  
14:47 <martinus\_\_> ou=cpu,c=cpu ?  
14:47 <boubou> yes  
14:47 <boubou> u want a printscreen ?  
14:47 <boubou> 2 sec  
14:47 <martinus\_\_> boubou, not 'dc' instead of 'c' ?  
14:48 <martinus\_\_> boubou, you should also check the group objectclass  
14:48 <martinus\_\_> xwiki.authentication.ldap.group\_classes , if yours is in the list  
14:48 <boubou> http://imgur.com/HPhLau1  
14:49 <boubou> [08:48:35] <martinus\_\_> xwiki.authentication.ldap.group\_classes , if yours is in the list --> How can I check that ? :S  
14:50 <martinus\_\_> boubou, how did you get from domain.qc.ca/DOMAIN/Applications/xwiki\_user to 'cn=xwiki\_users,ou=Applications,ou=cpu,c=cpu,c=qc,c=ca' ?  
14:50 <boubou> I just replaced CPU by domain  
14:50 <boubou> to hide the domain name ;)  
14:52 <lkrejci> has quit  
14:52 <martinus\_\_> boubou, I mean , if base\_DN=dc=cpu,dc=qc,dc=ca , the group full DN should be something underneath  this base DN  
14:52 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
14:52 <martinus\_\_> like 'cn=xwiki\_users,ou=Applications,dc=cpu,dc=qc,dc=ca'  
14:53 <martinus\_\_> \*not\* c=ca...  
14:54 <ClemensR> @xwiki\_finstern  ah, you do want two different properties .... does it work with a single one?  
14:55 <boubou> let me try it in 2 minutes  
14:55 <xwiki\_finstern> one property  
14:56 <xwiki\_finstern> I have multilpes class  
14:56 <xwiki\_finstern> but they all have one property in common  
14:56 <boubou> I thought that dc= was replaced by c= in xwiki.cfg  
14:56 <xwiki\_finstern> I want to use this to show all the documents originating from those multiple class in my livetable  
14:56 <boubou> martinus\_\_ you missed the ou=cpu in ur full dn  
14:56 <boubou> ;)  
14:57 <martinus\_\_> boubou, well, I wrote "like" :)  
14:57 <boubou> :D  
14:57 <xwiki\_finstern> the other way imply to rewrite the json  
14:57 <martinus\_\_> boubou, just to show the principle :)  
14:58 <martinus\_\_> boubou, dc is Domain Component  
14:58 <martinus\_\_> c is nothing to ldap  
14:58 <xwiki\_finstern> mmh ClemensR do you accept to talk in private ? I feel like I'm cutting boubou and martinus talk, it's a bit chaotic, am I right ?  
14:58 <ClemensR> xwiki\_finstern:  if they are in different classes they could as separate properties, usually  
14:58 <ClemensR> chat is chaotic, naturally :)  
14:59 <ClemensR> I have not much time, unfortunately have to leave in a few minutes (meeting, hooray)  
14:59 <xwiki\_finstern> I feel the pain  
14:59 <xwiki\_finstern> I have those too :-(  
14:59 <ClemensR> yes, the other way is to look at the XWiki.LiveTableResults page and try to write a simplified version of that and use this.  
15:00 <ClemensR> unfortunately XWiki.LiveTableResults has grown quite complex over the time, supports lots of features ... thus hard to understand  
15:00 <xwiki\_finstern> so to be fast and clear : each class have a common property named Typecheck and I intended to use it to show all the documents that have this property in their class  
15:01 <xwiki\_finstern> as I believe this is how the "extraParams" : "&yourProperty\_class=yourSpace.yourClass" work  
15:02 <xwiki\_finstern> a sample code would greatly help understanding how this option work :-S  
15:02 <ClemensR> yes, but it only shows docs for one class and property  
15:02 <boubou> martinus\_\_ should I puit the full dn case sensitive ?  
15:03 <martinus\_\_> boubou, it is not case sensitive  
15:03 <xwiki\_finstern> I don't understand ClemensR, what's the point of the option if it show only docs for one class ? since livetable already do this in standard ?  
15:04 <ClemensR> xwiki\_finstern: no, I mean it works for one combination of class and property, not one property in two different classes (I think)  
15:04 <xwiki\_finstern> so you mean that I would need to add a specific property for each class I want to show ?  
15:04 <xwiki\_finstern> mmmh  
15:05 <xwiki\_finstern> I will try that and see if it work, thank for the idea  
15:06 <xwiki\_finstern> (my Idea was that I would have the same property in each class, and put a different value for this property in each class)  
15:07 <xwiki\_finstern> ok, good luck for your meeting ClemensR, thank for the help  
15:07 <ClemensR> I guess with a custom HQL-Query that might be workeable, the differne clases, same property query, but not witht eh standard livetable, sorry  
15:08 <xwiki\_finstern> no pb  
15:08 <ClemensR> and yep, gotta run, thanls for unterstanding  
15:08 <xwiki\_finstern> well .. yes a problem, but it's mine to deal with ^^  
15:08 <xwiki\_finstern> good afternoon  
15:08 <martinus\_\_> boubou, I should leave but I'm pretty sure we found the issue  
15:09 <boubou> the issue is c= ?  
15:09 <xwiki\_finstern> I think yes boubou  
15:09 <boubou> ok thx  
15:09 <xwiki\_finstern> it should be dc=  
15:12 <martinus\_\_> thanks xwiki\_finstern  
15:12 <xwiki\_finstern> the "c" is for country name  
15:13 <boubou> :)  
15:13 <martinus\_\_> xwiki\_finstern, well, in a full DN, I don't think 'c' would means something useful :D  
15:16 <xwiki\_finstern> in Internet dns, you use the c for the country name, but in a private domain, it's not usefull you are right  
15:16 <xwiki\_finstern> except for a very large private domain, anyway, what he need here is the dc :)  
15:32 <boubou> I agree guys  
15:32 <boubou> It worked perfectly :S  
15:33 <boubou> about superadmin acces  
15:34 <boubou> I setupped the password in the xwiki.cfg  
15:34 <boubou> BUT if I try to connect with the user "superadmin" and the pass, the login failed  
15:45 <xwiki\_finstern> mmmh  
15:45 <xwiki\_finstern> I don't remember having any problem with the superadmin  
15:45 <xwiki\_finstern> but I used it a long time ago  
15:47 <Pbas1> Hello, FYI : http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/APIGuide?viewer=changes&rev1=29.2&rev2=30.1 (since robot doesn't send xwiki.org update)  
15:47 <xwiki\_finstern> are you sure you have uncommented the line ?  
15:48 <xwiki\_finstern> thank you Pbas1  
15:49 <Pbas1> np :-) thxs for xwiki work  
15:50 <xwiki\_finstern> boubou, # xwiki.superadminpassword=yourpassword should be uncommented if you need to use the superadmin  
15:50 <xwiki\_finstern> but you should not use it if not needed really  
15:50 <xwiki\_finstern> it's a last ressort when you have lost your admin account  
16:16 <boubou> ok  
16:16 <boubou> My LDAP auith work fine.  
16:17 <boubou> some users created a login in xwiki  
16:17 <boubou> how can I convert their local user to LDAP user ?  
16:20 <tmortagne> boubou: if you edit a LDAP user with object editor you will notice a LDAP profile object which contain LDAP uid and DN  
16:21 <tmortagne> to "convert" a standard XWiki user to LDAP XWiki user you just need to add this kind of object and set the right uid and DN  
16:21 <tmortagne> actually the uid is probably enough  
16:23 <boubou> The first time I connect a new user to the xwiki, the new user dont have access to nothing  
16:27 <tmortagne> this is no really related to the authenticator  
16:27 <tmortagne> it means user that are only in the default group don't have access to nothing  
16:27 <tmortagne> you should check your right setup  
16:28 <tmortagne> (default group is XWikiAllGroup)  
16:29 <boubou> only an admin can add a user to a wiki ?  
16:35 <tmortagne> yes  
16:45 <boubou> Thx Thomas  
16:45 <boubou> for LDAPS  
16:45 <boubou> http://pastebin.com/5j7SiaNV  
16:45 <boubou> Do I really need to configure a keystore ?  
16:46 <boubou> or can I just change my ldap port to 636 ?  
16:49 <tmortagne> boubou: I think you need a keystore but i'm really not a LDAPS expert sorry  
16:49 <boubou> I use ldaps with Centreon  
16:49 <boubou> I use openldap  
16:49 <boubou> and all is working perfectly  
16:52 <boubou> and to enable https on xwiki  
16:52 <lkrejci> has quit  
16:52 <boubou> is there a doc somewhere ?  
16:52 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
16:53 <boubou> is it wiki related or web server related ?  
17:07 <ClemensR> https  is web server related, in the ideal case XWiki will not even notice if it runs as http or https  
17:08 <lkrejci> has quit  
17:09 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
17:09 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
17:10 <boubou> I thought that xwiki can be install on Apache2 web server but it doesnt look a popular web server  
17:11 <acotiuga> has quit  
17:11 <tmortagne> boubou: it's more Java related actually, LDAP authenticator is using standard Java secure provider  
17:12 <tmortagne> it's using "com.sun.net.ssl.internal.ssl.Provider" by default to be more precise, then it's mostly about Java system properties to configure it  
17:16 <boubou> currently, I run Xwiki 7.0.1 on a CentOS with Glassfish  
17:16 <boubou> I would like to upgrade to the latest stable... 8.0.1 I think  
17:16 <boubou> how hard is it to export data then import it in the new server ?  
17:17 <boubou> I think I would like to use debian  
17:17 <boubou> on the next server  
17:17 <tmortagne> there is no reason to do export/import unless you want to change the kind of database to use IMO  
17:18 <tmortagne> if it's just about moving from one server to another and keep using MySQL for example the safest I think is to do a database dump and restore it on the new server and also move permanent directory  
17:19 <tmortagne> see http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Backup  
17:23 <boubou> mysql -v  
17:23 <boubou> Welcome to the MariaDB monitor.  Commands end with ; or \g.  
17:24 <boubou> it looks like I use MariaDB / MySQL  
17:24 <tmortagne> it's not really about what you use, it's about the difference between what you use currently and what you plan to use  
17:25 <xwiki\_finstern> mariadb is mostly compatible with mysql  
17:25 <tmortagne> if you plan to use MariaDB or MySQL then just to a backup on old instance and restore on the new one  
17:25 <tmortagne> then upgrade  
17:25 <boubou> currently, I use centos 7 with Glassfish  
17:25 <boubou> xwiki 7.0.1  
17:25 <xwiki\_finstern> the original author of mysql decided to fork from mysql after it was bought by oracle, that's all  
17:25 <boubou> yes  
17:25 <xwiki\_finstern> you should be safe with it  
17:26 <tmortagne> centos/Glasshfish should not matter much  
17:26 <boubou> what do u mean ?  
17:26 <boubou> :S  
17:26 <tmortagne> you can move to a different system and application server and it won't change the format of the data  
17:26 <boubou> ok  
17:26 <tmortagne> what is import is the database engine  
17:26 <xwiki\_finstern> and your xwiki settings too  
17:26 <tmortagne> yes  
17:26 <boubou> do u advice me to upgrade to debian ?  
17:27 <tmortagne> settings are listed on http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Backup  
17:27 <boubou> yes  
17:27 <tmortagne> the nice thing with Debian is that you have XWiki debian packages  
17:27 <tmortagne> makes upgrade easier  
17:27 <boubou> yes.... Its what I see too  
17:27 <tmortagne> I mostly use Debian but it's not really like I tried something else :)  
17:28 <xwiki\_finstern> your distribution choice is mostly related to your company choices I think, if you are in a company setup  
17:28 <xwiki\_finstern> mine work on redhat, I don't have the choice :D  
17:29 <xwiki\_finstern> in the end it's still a linux core with variations, xwiki should work the same  
17:29 <tmortagne> what I can tell you is that xwiki.org and XWiki SAS mostly use Debian so it's probably the system on which XWiki is tested the most, at least the system in which it's tested early  
17:30 <xwiki\_finstern> tmortagne, do you know who can help me with the livetable extraParams options ?  
17:31 <xwiki\_finstern> I'm still trying to make the custom Xproperty option working but I'm left with just this information :  
17:31 <xwiki\_finstern> This option can also be used to view properties of classes other than the one declared in className ("extraParams" : "&yourProperty\_class=yourSpace.yourClass" - sorting and filtering available from version 6.2.1.)  
17:32 <tmortagne> AFAIK extraParams is actually parameters sent to the JSON service URL  
17:32 <xwiki\_finstern> and I admit I havn't managed to get it work as intended for now  
17:32 <tmortagne> not really related to objects  
17:33 <tmortagne> the standard JSON service support a few option that are listed and the if you provide a custom one that's where you can put more options  
17:33 <xwiki\_finstern> an example would really help but I havn't found any related to this specific option  
17:33 <xwiki\_finstern> ok  
17:33 <tmortagne> an example of supported parameter is  
17:33 <tmortagne> "extraParams" : "&space=${doc.space}"  
17:33 <tmortagne> to get document only part of passed space  
17:34 <xwiki\_finstern> yes this one I managed to get it work  
17:34 <tmortagne> but there is not much parameters supported by default and they are all listed in http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Livetable+Macro#HParameter24options  
17:34 <sdumitriu1> has quit  
17:34 <xwiki\_finstern> it's specifically the "extraParams" : "&yourProperty=yourValue" that I can't make work  
17:34 <tmortagne>   p, li { white-space: pre-wrap; }  space, parent, orphaned, location  
17:34 <tmortagne> this one is URL parameters only  
17:35 <tmortagne> it won't have any effect with the standard service  
17:35 <tmortagne> if you want to use that you need to implement and declare a different service generating JSON for the livetable  
17:35 <tmortagne> it's indeed not very clear in extraParams documentation  
17:36 <tmortagne> see http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Livetable+Macro#HCustomJSON  
17:37 <tmortagne> hmm wait  
17:37 <tmortagne> it's a bit both actually it seems  
17:37 <tmortagne> looks like it can also have effect on the column of the table  
17:37 <tmortagne> but I don't think I ever used that  
17:38 <tmortagne> not really sure everything listed in extraParams is accurate  
17:38 <tmortagne> try the mailing list maybe  
17:38 <xwiki\_finstern> I only try to show in the livetable documents done with differents class, from the same space, instead of one class only  
17:38 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
17:38 <tmortagne> it's usually seen by more people  
17:38 <xwiki\_finstern> ok  
17:39 <xwiki\_finstern> I will try to check here, thank you tmortagne for trying to help  
17:39 <tmortagne> you're welcome  
17:40 <xwiki\_finstern> maybe it should be an idea of improvement for the Livetable to give the option to add multiple class for the "className" option  
17:41 <xwiki\_finstern> I think the case where we have multiple class must be something happening more than once, so the option may be usefull  
17:47 <tmortagne> yep  
17:54 <sdumitriu1> has joined #xwiki  
17:56 <boubou> tmortagne yes, in our compagny, we use OL7...  
17:56 <boubou> Its a compagny choiice  
17:57 <boubou> what do you advice me for the next xwiki version ?  
17:58 <boubou> My director want to stay on OL7  
17:59 <vmassol> take support from a professional company expert in xwiki like xwiki sas, see https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Support#HProfessionalSupport :)  
17:59 <vmassol> (note that I haven't followed the conversation, just seen oracle mentioned)  
18:03 <tmortagne> boubou: sorry I did not even knew this linux distribution existed  
18:03 <boubou> Its about exactly the same as Centos 7  
18:04 <boubou> Its a modified Centos 7 version  
18:04 <xwiki\_finstern> you should have the same setting as a redhat of the same version then  
18:05 <boubou> yes  
18:06 <boubou> which distrib are u using xwiki\_finstern ?  
18:06 <xwiki\_finstern> rhel  
18:06 <xwiki\_finstern> redhat  
18:06 <boubou> with Tomcat or Glassfish ?  
18:06 <xwiki\_finstern> tomcat  
18:07 <xwiki\_finstern> as it come standard in my company environment  
18:07 <xwiki\_finstern> glassfish isn't a possible choice on our servers  
18:07 <boubou> why ?  
18:08 <xwiki\_finstern> because the directors decided to use tomcat or weblogic, so those are the 2 java container avaiable :)  
18:08 <xwiki\_finstern> not my call  
18:09 <boubou> ok  
18:09 <boubou> about the same  
18:09 <xwiki\_finstern> standarized environment  
18:09 <boubou> exact  
18:09 <boubou> same here  
18:09 <boubou> is it easy to install with Tomcat ?  
18:09 <xwiki\_finstern> all server have the same context, if it wasn't the case, it would be a nightmare to maintain all the servers  
18:10 <xwiki\_finstern> oh yes  
18:10 <xwiki\_finstern> install tomcat  
18:10 <xwiki\_finstern> extract xwiki app in the webapps directory  
18:10 <xwiki\_finstern> configure  
18:11 <woshilapin> has quit  
18:11 <boubou> If I already have my Xwiki, I can skip the configure step  
18:11 <boubou> where is the webapps dir ?  
18:11 <xwiki\_finstern> I got the autorisation to install a mysql db specifically for xwiki so configuration was really easy  
18:12 <xwiki\_finstern> by default, in the tomcat folder  
18:13 <xwiki\_finstern> if you don't change the configuration, you will have xwiki into the webapps folder  
18:13 <xwiki\_finstern> and it will generate the data in the "work" folder but that's not a good pratice as the "work" folder is temporary  
18:15 <xwiki\_finstern> so you should configure your app data store somewhere (by default, the data are stored in the database, but if you intend like me to get a lot of attachment files .. better to configure it the other way)  
18:15 <xwiki\_finstern> it really depend what you intend to do with the xwiki  
18:16 <xwiki\_finstern> I mostly use it as an advanced knowledge base for my team  
18:17 <xwiki\_finstern> on redhat, you should have your tomcat installation in opt/
